item.title: Louis add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "It is remarkable how long men will believe in the bottomlessness of a pond without taking the trouble to sound it." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Louis add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music he hears, however measured or far away." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Louis add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "There is an incessant influx of novelty into the world, and yet we tolerate incredible dullness." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Louis add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "Only those who know the supremacy of the intellectual life──the life which has a seed of ennobling thought and purpose within──can understand the grief of one who falls from that serene activity into the absorbing soul-wasting struggle with worldly annoyances." -- George Eliot

item.title: Louis add a quote by Michael Pollan
item.description: "It's brutal out there. A bear will eat a lactating ewe alive, starting with her udders. as a rule, animals in the wild don't get good deaths surrounded by their loved ones." -- Michael Pollan

item.title: Louis add a quote by Jean Anthelme Brillat-Savarin
item.description: "The host took care to produce one or another of these whenever the current subjects seemed about used up, so that the conversation gathered new life and at the same time steered clear of political arguments, which are hindersome to both ingestion and digestion." -- Jean Anthelme Brillat-Savarin

item.title: Louis add a quote by Anthony Bourdain
item.description: "Vegetarians, and their Hezbollah-like splinter faction, the vegans ... are the enemy of everything good and decent in the human spirit." -- Anthony Bourdain

item.title: Louis add a quote by Anthony Bourdain
item.description: "your body is not a temple, it's an amusement park. Enjoy the ride." -- Anthony Bourdain

item.title: Louis add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Man träumt gar nicht, oder interessant -- Man muss lernen, ebeson zu wachen: -- gar nicht, oder interessant" -- Friedrich Nietzsche
